ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: none
Maybe 30 minutes reading up on speakers?
n/a
1 hours per week

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: I think there were interesting speakers that had applicable backgrounds we could relate to and learn from.
Strength is that you learn from leaders in HC space Weakness is sometimes the speakers do not address topics I would normally attend for.
It was a great opportunity to hear diverse speakers talk about their past and their current careers. A way it could be improved is to schedule it on Tuesday nights instead of Thursday nights.
Inspiring speaker series that lets you connect with potential mentors.
great guest speakers.

good - great speakers and was some of my favorites were surprises! Also appreciated the opportunity to get to know some visitors better via dinners Wish we knew we were going to have to write a final paper at the end of the year. Would have written it sooner right after my favorite speaker.

Loved being able to hear from a different speaker each week about their background/experiences, lessons on leadership, perspectives on healthcare, etc. I prefer the room to be set up lecture-style so that all attendees can see the speaker's face when he/she is talking (as opposed to all sitting around the large table). It was great to be able to go out to dinner with several of the speakers - I would have liked to be able to attend more. Colloquium was also scheduled on Thursdays, the same day as SOM Closing Bells.
Amazing speakers. More dinners with the speakers for each student.
Strengths: Fascinating presenters
amazing way to learn about the health care industry directly from amazing health care leaders
one of my favorite at Yale so far

Strengths: speakers are INCREDIBLE! Howie does a great job of assembling a diverse line-up and creating an environment for candid story-telling and discussion. Weaknesses: it would be great to have more notice about the final paper! The quality would be much better if I had taken time to write it immediately after a particularly inspiring talk, rather than during exam period. Also, this is minor, but it's unfortunate that the class time conflicts with Closing Bell, which is a nice opportunity for HCM and MBA students to socialize.
Strength: diverse range of inspiring speakers Weakness: speakers sometimes have quite generic speeches
It's really incredible to get the chance to meet such a diverse group of highly successful professionals in your chosen career path.

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Howard P Forman  Howie is the person who makes this course possible, due to his connections and network.
Instructor: Howard P Forman  Instructor's strength is his strong connections to all the speakers No real weakness, perhaps pushing discussion towards certain areas would be helpful
Instructor: Howard P Forman  Howie is overall a very good course instructor

Instructor: Howard P Forman  Howie is fantastic at organizing this speaker series and a great mentor/advisor. He really helps the students connect with the speakers of their choice to further their professional development.
Instructor: Howard P Forman  Brought in a great set of speakers this year. Would like to receive the biosketch via email (embedded within the body of the email) for easier viewing!
Instructor: Howard P Forman  Great
Instructor: Howard P Forman  Great moderator, amazing to watch how he makes connections
Instructor: Howard P Forman  does a great job of working hard to get great speakers!
Instructor: Howard P Forman  Brings in amazing speakers and a great overall experience
Instructor: Howard P Forman  Strength: Very passionate about the field, personal relationships with the speakers definitely key to making Colloquium possible Weakness: N/A

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I would say it's humbling to be able to listen and engage with such prominent leaders in the healthcare space.
Yes, it is useful for learning from HC leaders
Take this course if you're interested in hearing various speakers with a healthcare background discuss their path, their current career, and topics in healthcare.
Regular speaker series where you have the chance to listen to public health topics and careers from esteemed professionals
Great way to hear from some amazing leaders in healthcare!
Yes. The speakers are very inspiring.
Weekly (more-or-less) talks by current leaders in healthcare
Take it. Best visiting lecturers in YSPH
Great opportunity to hear from a range of experienced professionals in the healthcare field, not only about their careers but from differing viewpoints on the political spectrum

Seminar course where students meet in a small (40-50 attendees) and intimate setting with healthcare leaders and hear about their career and professional development advice. Given the minimal work required and the fantastic speaker opportunities, definitely recommend.
